ygData.subject: Installing cantera with visual c++ 2005 express (free download)

Hi all,

I have succeeded in building cantera from CVS using visual c++ 200=
5 
express which is a free download (like cantera itself), so good news 
fo=
r those without visual studio 2003.

Only problem is the (.vdproj) deployme=
nt project which makes the .msi 
installer is only supported by the 2005 pr=
o version, =3D pricey.

The current cantera files lack a deployment project=
 in the form of the 
new 'oneclick' format which is supported in VC++ 2005 =
express.

I have two questions, so please, to anyone who can help.

1) Afte=
r building the cantera CVS files, a build/lib directory is 
created with ob=
ject file libraries contained within. In order to run 
cantera using c++, a=
nd not python or matlab, is it possible to write 
routines that use these l=
ibraries directly, and not have to install 
cantera using a .msi file? Basi=
cally working without the additional 
overhead.

2) Is it necessary to have=
 visual fortran to build cantera, if fortran 
files are not to be used. I h=
ave read that some parts of Cantera use 
fortran based code, requiring a fo=
rtran compiler during build.
I just want to know if Cantera can be complete=
ly built using visual 
studio alone.

I intend to post instructions on how =
to setup and use Cantera from c++ 
alone using this free Express version. T=
his would be of interest to 
many that only want to use c++ with cantera.

=
Thanks in advance to any repliers,
Cheers,
Adam.
